body:
@alalazo @scheibelp 

I'm using an external MPI, which was hand-installed, with a hand-built module.  I need to load the module to properly build my tree.  Thus, I need to use `--dirty`.  It would be cleaner if I could specify this module somewhere; for example, in `config.yaml`:
```
config:
  dirty: false
  modules: [other/comp/gcc-5.3-sp3 module load other/mpi/openmpi/1.10.1-gcc-5.3-sp3]
```

Is there any way to do this????  I didn't find one, although I know there are a number of places where Spack will load modules for you (in `compilers.yaml`, for example).

PS: I have to load the `gcc` module because the `openmpi` module has been hand-coded to require it.
title: Load a module as general build environment?
